intro: Quiabentia chacoensis var. jujuyensis, commonly known as the Jujuyan quiabentia, is a flowering plant native to the dry regions of northern Argentina and southern Bolivia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive yellow-orange flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its range.
